instructions: Image titled Turn Off Spotlight Look Up on an iPhone Step 1 1 Open your iPhone's Settings. This is the gray gear icon located on your Home Screen. Image titled Turn Off Spotlight Look Up on an iPhone Step 2 2 Tap . Image titled Turn Off Spotlight Look Up on an iPhone Step 3 3 Tap . Image titled Turn Off Spotlight Look Up on an iPhone Step 4 4 Slide the switch next to to off position. This will disable Spotlight Look Up from suggesting results from the Web, iTunes, App Store, movie showtimes, and nearby map locations when you search. Spotlight will still give you the option to search the web after you disable this feature, but it will not make automatic suggestions. Turning off Suggestions will also disable your iPhone from sending your search-related usage data to Apple, and limit all searches to the contents of your device. Image titled Turn Off Spotlight Look Up on an iPhone Step 5 5 Slide the switch to off position for every app listed under Search Results. It'll turn white. This will disable Spotlight from searching the content of the apps you have installed, and Spotlight will only search the contents of your device. Note that this applies to both of Spotlight's Look Up and Search functions. It is not possible to exclude an app from Look Up, but not Search, or vice versa. Image titled Turn Off Spotlight Look Up on an iPhone Step 6 6 Tap the back button at the top-left corner of your screen. Advertisement
